newsitem.title: UK: UK three-month Ecu bills' top accepted yield falls.
newsitem.headline: UK three-month Ecu bills' top accepted yield falls.

text.p: The highest accepted yield at Tuesday's auction of 500 million of Ecu three-month Treasury bills fell to 3.94 percent from last month's 3.99 percent, the Bank of England said.
That compares with an average yield of 3.92 percent, the BOE said.
The highest accepted yield for the 200 million Ecu offer of one-month bills rose to 3.95 percent from 3.99 percent last month and compares with an average yield of 3.93 percent.
The auction of 300 million Ecu six-month bills produced a highest accepted yield of 3.90 percent, compared with 3.98 percent last month, and an average yield of 3.89 percent.
The thee-part tender totalling one billion Ecu met applications of 2.261 billion Ecu and was allotted in full. The Bank took an additional 50 million of bills onto its own books.
The next Ecu tender will be on Tuesday, February 11, the Bank said. Details will be released on February 4.
